results.title: Wonders in the desert
results.brief_description: A young girl and her younger brother take a walk in the desert, where they discover an adult and a baby jack rabbit, a wild female burro and her young one, a lizard, a horned lizard, chuckwalla, a pocket mouse and a desert tortoise.

results.title: Wonders in a country stream. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Encourages the observation and appreciation of small living things by showing children near a stream discovering tadpoles, frogs, damsel flies, newts, a turtle and a water spider. Suitable for primary school children.

results.title: Wonderful world of the Brothers Grimm
results.creator_credit: Turner Entertainment, Cinerama, Gallen Films, George Pal and Henry Levin
results.brief_description: Brothers Wilhelm and Jacob Grimm (Laurence Harvey and Karl Boehm) are commissioned to write a family history for a local Duke; the setting, the nineteenth century. The task seems doomed as Wilhelm is far more content creating stories about fairies, elves, knights and princesses to include in a collection of folktales. Jacob reluctantly agrees to help his brother, provided it doesn’t interfere with the serious task at hand. This fictionalised account of two of the world’s greatest story tellers is interspersed with adaptations of some of their stories. An international cast brings to life some of the Brothers Grimms’ best loved fairy tales including “The Dancing Princess”, “The Cobbler and the elves” and “The Singing bone”. The cast of these fairy tales includes Claire Bloom, Karl Boehm, Walter Slezak, Oscar Homolka, Barbara Eden, Yvette Mimieux, Jim Backus and Beulah Bondi. A delightful account that will be enjoyed by viewers of all ages.

results.title: Wonderful world
results.brief_description: A world tour the easy way. The Swiss Alps, Venice, Florence, Rome, Vienna, Amsterdam , Brussels, the East, Egypt, and Arabia, India, Japan and the Pacific, Africa, Australia, Canada and the USA, South America - songs and dances, the Sphinx, and the Taj Mahal, Notre Dame in Paris , bull fighting in Spain, and St Lawrence sea-way, from London to Penang; The Statue to liberty to Sydney harbour Bridge; and many other famous and exotic places.

results.title: Wonder walks: how do they move?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Warren Brown
results.brief_description: Examines the similarities and differences in the way various animals move and the special ways they are adapted to their environment. Without dialogue. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Wonder jet
results.brief_description: The history of the development of the jet engine by Frank Whittle at the RAF College, Cranwell. The film illustrates some of the hazards and difficulties experienced during the long years of research and experimentation which led, ultimately, to the first successful jet-propelled gas-turbine engine. The film ends with a short summary of the probable uses of jet engines in the future. No other credits available.

results.title: Wonder dogs in action
results.brief_description: Hunting in the Arizona Hills and wilds of America with “the sportsman’s best and most faithful companion”: the Hound. This film documents the behaviour and physicality of American hunt dogs such as the Fox Hound as well at the Irish Setter, Pointer, French Poodle and Labrador. The film describes each breed’s good points as hunters and retrievers, “over land and in water”.

results.title: Wonder dog (K)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales of Pluto”.
Pluto tries to impress his girlfriend by impersonating a circus dog. The feats he must perform, however, prove to be much tricker than he expected.

results.title: Wonder boys
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin and Curtis Hanson
results.brief_description: From the director of “LA Confidential” and based on the novel by Michael Chabon, “Wonder Boys” directed by Curtis Hanson is a dry witted comedy about middle aged writing professor Grady Tripp (Michael Douglas) who is having trouble surpassing the success of his first novel with bad case of writer’s block. Things are not going well for him in life generally as a student (Tobey Maquire) is obsessed with him, his married lover is pregnant (Frances McDormand) and his wife has left him. Academy Award winner for Best Music, Song by Bob Dylan. Cast includes Robert Downey Jr, Katie Holmes and Rip Torn with screenplay by Steve Kloves.
